columns.text: There's a (not-to-be accepted) offer of money tripling within a year. We need to calculate the return rate per quarter.

The supposed offer is to triple our money. This means that money will be worth three times more **in the future**, making it the **future value**.

**Future value** of singular cash flow or asset is calculated as:

$$\text{FV}=\text{C} \times (1+\text{r})^\text{t}$$

where:

$\text{FV}$ = future value;\
$\text{C}$ = amount of cash;\
$\text{r}$ = interest rate (in decimals);\
$\text{t}$ = time passed.

Let's now look at what parameters are offered in the task:




| Parameters| Values| 
|--|:--:| 
| Future value| $\text{3C}$| 
| Total period | Quarterly = 4 times a year|

With these values, **annual interest rate will be**:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{FV}&=\text{C} \times (1+\text{r})^\text{t}\\[10pt]
3\times \cancel{\text{C}}&=\cancel{\text{C}} \times (1+\text{r})^{4}\\[10pt]
\end{aligned}$$

We will raise both sides of the equations to the power of $\dfrac{1}{4}$:

$$\begin{aligned}
3^\frac{1}{4}&=1+\mathrm{r_q}\\[10pt]
1.316&=1+\text{r}\\[10pt]
\mathrm{r_q}&=0.316\\[10pt]
&=\boxed{31.6\%}
\end{aligned}$$
In this exercise, we will determine the quarterly rate of return if an investment offers can triple your cash in 12 months.

To find the rate, we will utilize the spreadsheet function RATE. The rate function is a financial function that calculates the rate based on the period, present value, and future value. The rate spreadsheet formula is as follows:

$$\begin{aligned}
RATE&=(nper,pmt,pv,[fv],[type]) \\
\end{aligned}$$


Where:

$nper$, which refers to the period\
$pmt$, which means the constant payment\
$pv$, which represent the present value\
$fv$, the future value\
$type$, which indicates the basis of the calculation, either year-end or beginning of the year

We will assume a figure for the present value of $1,000 tripled after a year; hence, the future value is $3,000 to determine the rate. We will consider the following details:

| Particulars   |           |
|---------------|-----------|
| Present value | $1,000 |
| Future value        | $3,000        |
| Period        | 4 (quarters)    |

Let's now find the rate using a spreadsheet. Note that the present value should be negative for the function to work correctly.

!['slader'](https://slader-solution-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/52a20d65-51b9-4dc5-9bc3-80148bd427fe-1642089495598656.png)
 

**Therefore, based on our calculation, the quarterly rate of return if an investment can triple your money in 12 months is 33.61%.**
